If I can’t get a good vocal sample, I might synthesize it, but that’s a trickier path. I prefer to work with real speech and warp it to match the new visuals. I select source material that allows me to extract a range of emotions: anger, surprise, calm, frustration. These emotional states are then mapped onto the new script. The goal is to create a video that feels *authentic*, so the viewer doesn’t just believe the words—they believe the intent behind them.
